title: MH Organizations in Nigeria
name: MH Organizations in Nigeria
description: This is a list of organizations in Nigeria that work on maternal health

properties.name: Action Family Foundation
properties.information: Action Family Foundation is a Nigerian NGO engaged in   health, family and community development. It recognizes and   engages the family as a point of intervention to prevent   disease, promote health and manage crises.
properties.address: 2B, Adebowale Close, Mende, Maryland, P.O. Box 72221, Victoria Island

properties.name: Action Group on Adolescent Health (AGAH)
properties.information: AGAH is a student-based advocacy group committed to the   well-being of young persons (ages 10-24 years) especially   as it relates to their sexual and reproductive health and   rights. AGAH is based in the College of Medicine of the   University of Lagos.
properties.address: University of Lagos, College of Medicine

properties.name: Action Health Incorporated (AHI)
properties.information: AHI is a pioneering NGO dedicated to improving the health   of Nigerian adolescents. It is concerned about the   prevailing poor status of adolescent sexual and   reproductive health and has taken on the mandate to serve   as a catalyst for change.

properties.name: Action In Distress Foundation (AID)
properties.information: Action in Distress Foundation is an independent,   nongovernment, nonprofit organization that works to promote   the sexual and reproductive health and rights of mothers.

properties.name: ActionAid Nigeria
properties.information: ActionAid works with the poor and excluded, promoting   values and commitment in civil society, institutions, and   governments with the aim of achieving structural changes in   order to eradicate injustices and poverty in the world.
properties.address: 2nd Floor, NAIC House, Lot 590, Cadastral Zone, Central Business District

properties.name: Adolescent Health and Information Projects (AHIP)
properties.information: AHIP is a non-governmental, not-for-profit organization   implementing youth focused programs in northern Nigeria.   Its major focus areas are health, and social and economic   issues related to young people and women.
properties.address: AHIP Centre, Kano, Gidan AHIP, Plot 270/271, Maiduguri Road, P.O. Box 12846

properties.name: ADVANCE (Mission Africa Project)
properties.information: ADVANCE works to bring about positive changes in peoples   living conditions and behaviours, through capacity building   initiatives for church leaders and community members in   HIV/AIDS prevention, care and support, and impact   mitigation in QIC/UEC communities in Nigeria.
properties.address: 46 Dan Suleiman Street, Utako, P.O. Box 15156

properties.name: Ashoka - Nigeria
properties.information: Ashoka strives to shape a global, entrepreneurial,   competitive citizen sector: one that allows social   entrepreneurs to thrive and enables the world’s citizens to   think and act as changemakers.
properties.address: Plot 127, Oyo Street, Area II Garki

properties.name: Association for Child Health
properties.information: The Association for Child Health advocates for the reproductive health rights of adolescents through various organizations and communities and seeks to control the spread of HIV/AIDS.
properties.address: c/o Network for Adolescents and Youth of Africa, Planned Parenthood Federation of Nigeria, 224 Ikodu Road

properties.name: Association for Reproductive and Family Health (ARFH)
properties.information: ARFH is committed to improving the quality of life for   people in Nigeria and elsewhere in sub-Saharan Africa, to   respond to the challenges posed by HIV/AIDS, and to address   adolescent social, sexual and reproductive health problems   and maternal mortality.
properties.address: Army Officers Mess Road, Plot 815A, Agodi G.R.A., Ikolaba

properties.name: BAOBAB for Womens Human Rights
properties.information: BAOBAB's mission is to promote women's human rights   principally via improving knowledge, exercise and   development of rights under religious laws, customary laws   and statutory laws.

properties.name: Butro Abue Memorial Foundation (BAMF)
properties.information: BAMF has a mission to improve the quality of life for women   through healthcare, literacy, and income generation   activities for sustainability and to raise awareness for   HIV/AIDS through educational campaigns and to advocate   for orphaned and vulnerable children.

properties.name: Campaign Against Unwanted Pregnancy (CAUP)
properties.information: CAUP is the lead group advocating for increased access to   safe abortion in Nigeria. Through years of legal, medical,   media, and public engagement CAUP has built a strong and   diverse base of support for sexuality education, family   planning, safe abortion, and increased adoption options.

properties.name: Center for Adolescent Research, Education and Sexuality (CARES)
properties.information: CARES is a nonprofit NGO focusing on adolescent reproductive health and women's issues, especially in the areas of FGM, abortion and STD/HIV/AIDS prevention.

properties.name: Centre for Communication and Reproductive Health Services (CCRHS)
properties.information: CCRHS was established in 1998 in response to the need to create awareness in matters relating to reproductive health issues to enhance safe motherhood and it aims to improve the quality of life for the people in its immediate environment and Nigeria at large.

properties.name: Centre for Development and Population Activities (CEDPA) - Nigeria
properties.information: CEDPA has worked in Nigeria since 1985 to increase support for girls’ education and empower women and their families to improve reproductive health and maternal health.
properties.address: Ground Floor, Bel House, 22, Port Harcourt Crescent, Area 11

properties.name: Centre for Health Science Training, Research and Development  (CHESTRAD)
properties.information: CHESTRAD's goal is to serve as an in-country resource for training, research and information in the areas of reproductive health for young people and women in poor resource settings, child survival, tropical diseases and information management for health and related sciences.
properties.address: 29 Aare Avenue, New Bodija Estate, UIPO, P.O. Box 21633

properties.name: Centre for Healthworks, Development and Research (CHEDRES)
properties.information: CHEDRES is concerned primarily with promoting safe motherhood initiatives among women in riverside communities in Cross River and four states in south Nigeria.

properties.name: Centre for Research in Reproductive Health (CRRH)
properties.information: CRRH was established in 1988 to undertake The Breastfeeding Project, a WHO-funded, multi-disciplinary research programme on breastfeeding, infant health and the return of maternal fertility after childbirth.

properties.name: Centre for Womens Health and Information (CEWHIN)
properties.information: CEWHIN is an independent, not for profit, nongovernmental organization established for the promotion of and respect for human rights of women and young girls, especially their reproductive and sexual health and rights.

properties.name: Child Health Organization
properties.information: CHO's vision is to be a leader in maternal and child survival and in sustaining human development. It is committed to service and creating a dynamic atmosphere for anticipating and meeting the needs of Nigerian women and children, and upholding a high level of integrity, ethics and transaparency.

properties.name: Child Rights Organization
properties.information: The Child Rights Organization supports and promotes the implementation of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, works to promote children's health through social mobilization for immunization and control of malaria, and supports children living with HIV/AIDS.

properties.name: Community Health and Research Initiative (CHR)
properties.information: CHR is based in Kano State and aims to promote sexual and reproductive health and child survival in Nigeria.
properties.address: #13, Lamuya Office Complex, BU K Road, P.O. Box 14807

properties.name: Community Life Project
properties.information: The Community Life Project works with a participatory, community-based, demand-driven approach to provide reproductive health and HIV/AIDs education and to promote family and community development.

properties.name: Department for International Development (DFID) - Nigeria
properties.information: DFID is the part of the UK government that manages Britain's aid to poor countries and works to get rid of extreme poverty.

properties.name: DevCom
properties.information: Media Deliver Now! is a media response drawing public attention to the more than 1.0 million children and 55,000 maternal deaths occuring annually in Nigeria.    Web

properties.name: Education as a Vaccine Against AIDS (EVA)
properties.information: EVA's mission is to establish systems and structures that will provide opportunities for youth to make responsible decisions concerning their development.

properties.name: Family Centered Initiative for Challenged Persons (FACICP)
properties.information: FACICP is an NGO that works to mainstream disability issues in maternal health programs by addressing the social, cultural and institutional barriers that exclude women with disabilities from enjoying quality maternal health care.

properties.name: Family Health International (FHI) - Nigeria
properties.information: FHI Nigeria helps provide health care support for HIV prevention and HIV/AIDS and TB treatment.
properties.address: GHAIN National Office, Plot 1073-A1, Godab Plaza, J.S. Tarka Street, Area 3, P.M.B. 44, Garki, Abuja

properties.name: Federation of Muslim Womens Associations in Nigeria (FOMWAN)
properties.information: FOMWAN's mission is to propagate the religion of Islam through da’awah, educational institutions and other outreach, and to improve the status of women, youth and children through training, education, health and humanitarian services, micro enterprise and advocacy.

properties.name: Feminist Vision Care Initiative
properties.information: The Feminist Vision Care Initiative works to educate,  inform, motivate and inspire individuals and society to   positive inspiration and aspirations, dispel human   ignorance, and ensure collective and global happiness   for the betterment of mankind.
properties.address: 33 Int. Airport Road, Rokpokwu, P.O. Box 1540

properties.name: Ford Foundation - West Africa
properties.information: The Ford Foundation's work in West Africa concentrates on Nigeria, and the promotion of human rights, the empowerment of women and youth by improving their health and social status, enhancing livelihoods of the poor, and promoting transport and good government.    Web

properties.name: Freedom Foundation
properties.information: Freedom Foundation is a non-profit, non-governmental organization set up in 2001 to pioneer the concept of humanity security.
properties.address: The Rain Institute, 43 Afribank Street (Nurses House)

properties.name: Gede Foundation
properties.information: Gede's mission is to promote healthy communities by restoring the individual’s right to health through education and access to services.

properties.name: Girls Power Initiative (GPI)
properties.information: GPI is a Nigerian non-governmental, not-for-profit youth development organization founded in 1993 to address the challenges facing girls in Nigerian society and equip them with information, skills and opportunities to grow into self-actualized young women.    Website
properties.address: 44 Ekpo Abasi Street, P.O. Box 3663, UNICAL Post Office

properties.name: Global Health Awareness Research Foundation (GHARF)
properties.information: GHARF envisions a society where women and adolescents are free from sexual and reproductive health problems and their rights recognized. It works to empower adolescents and women through education, research, documentation, service provision and income-generation opportunities.    Website

properties.name: Grassroots Health Organization of Nigeria (GHON)
properties.information: GHON’s goal is to assist the community through grassroots participation and mobilization to uplift the reproductive health and socio-economic status of the community.    Website
properties.address: 3 Abdu Sambo Street (opposite Gandun Albasa Rail Line), P.O. Box 4704

properties.name: Health and Life international (HEALIN)
properties.information: The primary mission of HEALIN is to provide quality health care for Nigeria's poor and less-privileged citizens and is built out of concern for the deteriorating health standards of rural dwellers in most African countries.    Website

properties.name: Helpscape
properties.information: Helpscape works with adolescent (single) parents to alleviate economic hardship and encourage positive self-image.
properties.address: 9-10 Trade Fair Complex, P.O. Box 22478, University Post Office

properties.name: International Center for Reproductive Health and Sexual Rights (INCRESE)
properties.information: INCRESE is the leading Nigerian NGO working for a favourable environment and expanding access to sexual health and rights information and services.

properties.name: International Reproductive Rights Research Action Group (IRRRAG)
properties.information: IRRRAG's mission is, using a practical feminist approach to research and action to eliminate all socio – cultural/religious barriers that prevent women from enjoying their reproductive and sexual health and rights.    Website
properties.address: IRRRAG Nigeria, 43 Ehaekpen Street, P.O. Box 14286

properties.name: Ipas - Nigeria
properties.information: Ipas Nigeria works to increase women’s access to vital reproductive health care, providing post-abortion care and family planning, and strengthening alliances and partnerships in support of women’s sexual and reproductive health and rights.    Website

properties.name: Jhpiego - Nigeria
properties.information: Jhpiego’s involvement in Nigeria includes activities focusing on malaria in pregnancy, emergency obstetric and neonatal care, and postpartum family planning.    Website

properties.name: John Snow, Inc. (JSI) USAID Deliver Project - Nigeria
properties.information: JSI and its nonprofit affiliate JSI Research and Training Institute, Inc. are public health research and consulting firms dedicated to improving the health of individuals and communities throughout the world. JSI builds local capacity to address critical health problems, collaborating with local partners to assist countries, governments, communities, families, and individuals to develop their skills and identify solutions that meet their public health needs. Through management assistance, research and evaluation, education, and training, JSI works to enable agencies and health professionals to provide appropriate services in an effective and compassionate manner.    Website
properties.address: Plot #797, Mohammadu Buhari Way, Central Area, Garki District

properties.name: Life Planning Association
properties.information: Life Planning Association is a NGO dealing with primary health care services in selected rural areas in Ibadan City of Oyo-state in Nigeria.

properties.name: MacArthur Foundation
properties.information: The MacArthur Foundation supports creative people   and effective institutions committed to building a more   just, verdant, and peaceful world. In addition to   selecting the MacArthur Fellows, it works to defend   human rights, advance global conservation and security,   make cities better places, and understand how technology   is affecting children and society.    Website
properties.address: Amma House, 4th Floor, Plot 432 Yakubu Pam Street, Central Business District

properties.name: Marie Stopes International (MSI) - Nigeria
properties.information: MSI is a not-for-profit sexual and reproductive healthcare organization, providing a variety of services around the world, including: family planning; safe abortion; vasectomy; female sterilization; and maternal and child healthcare.    Website
properties.address: Unit 2, Erisco Bonpet Plaza, Herbert Macauley Way, Wuse, Federal Capital Territory

properties.name: Ministry of Womens Affairs
properties.information: The Ministry of Women's Affairs is involved in implementing efforts to advance the status of women and thier families, including the Better Life Programme for Rural Women and the Family Support Programme.    http://www.ilo.org/public/english/employment/gems/eeo/program/nigeria/fmwa.htm
properties.address: Annex 3, New Federal Secretariat, Shehu Shagari Way, Central Area, P.M.B. 229

properties.name: National Primary Health Care Development Agency (NPHCDA)
properties.information: NPHCDA's mission is to provide leadership that supports the promotion and implementation of high quality and sustainable primary health care for all through resource mobilization, partnerships, collaboration, development of community based systems and functional infrastructure.    http://www.nphcda.gov.ng/
properties.address: Plot 681/682, Port Harcourt Crescent (off Gimbiya Street)

properties.name: Niger Delta Women for Justice (NDWJ)
properties.information: NDWJ works to facilitate the empowerment of disadvantaged women particularly those in rural areas and urban slums through programmes of participatory development.

properties.name: Nigeria Federal Ministry of Health
properties.information: The Federal Ministry of Health works to strengthen the national health system to deliver effective, efficient, quality and affordable health services that foster improved health status of Nigerians.
properties.address: New Federal Secretariat Complex, Phase III, Ahmadu Bello Way, Central Business District, P.M.B. 083

properties.name: Nigerian Association of University Women
properties.information: The Nigerian Association of University Women is a group of graduate women interested in improving the mental, social, and physical lives of women and girls in Nigeria, focusing on Ikeja, the capital of Lagos State.    http://members.fortunecity.com/nauw_ikeja/NAUWIKEJABRANCH.html

properties.name: Nigerian Center for Gender, Health and Human Rights (NCGHHR)
properties.information: NCGHHR focuses on gender, health and human rights, and combines a strong commitment to service and advocacy with human rights education in Nigeria and sub-Saharan Africa. NCGHHR is a non-profit, non-governmental organization.    http://ncghhr.tripod.com/humanrights/

properties.name: Nigerian Medical Association (NMA)
properties.information: The NMA strives to ensure that doctors and dentists   uphold the Declaration of Geneva, promotes the   advancement of health, and assists the government   of Nigeria in providing health care to the country.   It also advises the government on legislation   affecting the delivery of health care.    http://www.nigeriannma.org/aboutus.htm
properties.address: 8 Benghazi Street (off Addis Ababa Crescent), Wuse Zone 4, P.O. Box 8829

properties.name: Obafemi Awolowo University Centre for Gender and Social Policy Studies
properties.information: The Centre for Gender and Social Policy Studies (Obafemi Awolowo University), is a centre of excellence for interdisciplinary study of gender and development issues.    http://www.oauife.edu.ng/research/cgs/index.htm

properties.name: Partnership for Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (PMNCH) - Nigeria
properties.information: The Nigeria PMNCH was launched on March 28, 2007 to address the issues of MNCH in Nigeria through concerted efforts. PMNCH - Nigeria seeks to coordinate the various actors and resources in order to increase efficiency and impact.    http://www.who.int/pmnch/en
properties.address: New Federal Secretariat Complex Phase III, Ahmadu Bello Way, Central Business District, P.M.B. 083

properties.name: Pathfinder International - Nigeria
properties.information: Since 1965, Pathfinder International has been a leader in supporting accessible reproductive health care and family planning throughout Nigeria.    http://www.pathfind.org/site/PageServer?pagename=Programs_Nigeria

properties.name: Pearl of Africa
properties.information: The Pearl of Africa works to reduce maternal deaths through accountability, transparency, information sharing and training of traditional birth attendants by collaborating with hospitals and skilled health workers.
properties.address: C/O Lawna Theological Seminary, P.O. Box 1120

properties.name: Planned Parenthood Federation of Nigeria (PPFN) - Lagos State Association
properties.information: Through partnerships and capacity building, PPFN strives to increase access to quality SRH services using gender-sensitive strategies that respond to the diverse socio-cultural factors in the country.    http://www.ppfn.org/
properties.address: 1 Victoria Street, Family Planning House (by Oceanic Bank Place)

properties.name: Planned Parenthood Federation of Nigeria (PPFN) - Main Office
properties.information: Through partnerships and capacity building, PPFN strives to increase access to quality SRH services using gender-sensitive strategies that respond to the diverse socio-cultural factors in the country.    http://www.ppfn.org/

properties.name: Planned Parenthood Federation of Nigeria (PPFN) - South East Regional Association
properties.information: Through partnerships and capacity building, PPFN strives to increase access to quality SRH services using gender-sensitive strategies that respond to the diverse socio-cultural factors in the country.    http://www.ppfn.org/
properties.address: 4 Onitsha Road (near FRCN Enugu National Station)

properties.name: Planned Parenthood Federation of Nigeria (PPFN) - South Regional Association
properties.information: Through partnerships and capacity building, PPFN strives to increase access to quality SRH services using gender-sensitive strategies that respond to the diverse socio-cultural factors in the country.    http://www.ppfn.org/

properties.name: Population Council - Nigeria
properties.information: The Population Council aims to address the maternal and reproductive health needs of vulnerable populations, provide preventive programming regarding HIV and AIDS, and empower local NGOs to better address health, education, and quality-of-life issues.    http://www.popcouncil.org/africa/nigeria.html
properties.address: Bassan Plaza, Block B, 3rd Floor, Plot 759 (off Herbert Macaulay Way), Central Business District

properties.name: Poverty Alleviation for the Poor Initiative (PAFPI)
properties.information: PAFPI envisions a productive and healthy people (children and women) in a safe and clean environment with relevant skills, good and healthy living and improved means of sustainable livelihood, who are conscious of their rights and responsibilities and fully integrated into the development process in the Niger Delta region.

properties.name: Princess Nicky Breast Cancer Foundation
properties.information: The Princess Nikky Breast Cancer Foundation is at the forefront of cancer awareness in Nigeria.    http://www.annieappleseedproject.org/prnibrcafo.html

properties.name: Pro-Health International
properties.information: Pro-Health International is a Christian, non-profit voluntary health care organization with a focus on uplifting the health status of the less privileged and neglected rural populace in Africa.    http://www.prohealthinternational.org/

properties.name: Program for Appropriate Technology in Health (PATH) - Nigeria
properties.information: PATH is an international nonprofit organization that creates   sustainable, culturally relevant solutions, enabling communities   worldwide to break longstanding cycles of poor health. By   collaborating with diverse public and private sector partners,   PATH helps provide appropriate health technologies and vital   strategies that change the way people think and act. Its work   improves global health and well-being.    http://path.org
properties.address: 35 Justice George Sowemimo Street (off TY Danjuma Street)

properties.name: Rotarian Action Group For Population Growth and Sustainable Development (RIFPD)
properties.information: Currently, the project "Improvement of Maternal & Child Health" is underway in the states of Kano and Kaduna and is a comprehensive approach to treat and prevent obstetric fistula, malnutrition and disease.    http://www.rifpd.org/Projects/MaternalHealth.shtml

properties.name: Smallholders Foundation
properties.information: The mission of The Smallholders Foundation is to tackle extreme poverty and hunger among rural small farmers by boosting small scale agricultural production.    http://www.smallholdersfoundation.org
properties.address: 1 Umugakwo Umuoba Road, (off MCC-Uratta Road), P.O. Box 3508

properties.name: Social Care Initiative For Families And Children
properties.information: Social Care Initiative for Families and Children strives to be a world class community-based organization that shall focus on safe motherhood and address social and cultural factors that impart negatively on maternal health.    http://socialcare-ng.org

properties.name: Society for Family Health (SFH) - Lagos
properties.information: SFH’s mission is to empower Nigerians to lead healthier lives. Working with the private and public sectors, it uses social marketing and behaviour change communication to improve access to health information, services, and products to motivate the adoption of healthy behaviours.    http://www.sfhnigeria.org/
properties.address: Awaye House, 2nd Floor, Suites 5 and 6, Lagos/Badagry Expressway (Coker Bus Stop)

properties.name: Society for Family Health (SFH) - Main Office
properties.information: SFH’s mission is to empower Nigerians to lead healthier lives. Working with the private and public sectors, it uses social marketing and behaviour change communication to improve access to health information, services, and products to motivate the adoption of healthy behaviours.    http://www.sfhnigeria.org/

properties.name: Society of Gynecology and Obstetrics of Nigeria (SOGON)
properties.information: The Mission of SOGON is to promote the health and well-being of Nigerian women and to improve the practice of obstetrics and gynecology in the country.    http://sogon.netfirms.com/
properties.address: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Jos University Teaching Hospital

properties.name: The Adolescent Project
properties.information: The Adolescent Project serves teenage girls who have been kicked out of their homes. The project offers pre-natal counseling, job training, and democracy education - all part of its effort to help young people stand on their own.    http://www.as-technologies.com/tap/aboutus.htm

properties.name: The Presbyterian Community Services and Development (PCSD)
properties.information: PCSD envisions a community that is physically, spiritually, socially, economically and environmentally whole as God originally intended for humankind.    http://www.presbyteriandevelopment.org/

properties.name: The Real Women Foundation (RWF)
properties.information: he Real Woman Foundation (RWF) is dedicated to supporting the emotional and spiritual needs of specific women and children groups. It is active in providing rehabilitation facilities for women and children with a history of abuse and neglect.    http://www.therealwoman.org/home.asp

properties.name: The World Bank Group - Nigeria
properties.information: The World Bank is helping to fight poverty and improve living standards for the people of Nigeria.    http://web.worldbank.org/nigeria

properties.name: The World Bank Group - Nigeria
properties.information: The World Bank is helping to fight poverty and improve living standards for the people of Nigeria.    http://web.worldbank.org/nigeria
properties.address: International Finance Corporation (IFC), Maersk House, 1st Floor, Plot 121, Louis Soloman Close (off Ahmadu Bello Way)

properties.name: UNICEF - Nigeria
properties.information: UNICEF’s overall goal is to promote and protect the rights of children and women through enhancing the capacity and commitment of government and civil society.    http://www.unicef.org/infobycountry/nigeria_1463.html
properties.address: United Nations House, Plot 617/618, Diplomatic Zone

properties.name: UNIFEM - West Africa
properties.information: UNIFEM is the women's fund at the United Nations. It provides financial and technical assistance to innovative programmes and strategies to foster women's empowerment and gender equality.    http://www.unifem.org/

properties.name: United Nations Development Program (UNDP) - Nigeria
properties.information: UNDP is the UN's global development network, an organization advocating for change and connecting countries to knowledge, experience and resources to help people build a better life.    http://www.ng.undp.org/
properties.address: United Nations House, Plot 617/618, Diplomatic Zone

properties.name: United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) - Nigeria
properties.information: UNFPA is the world's largest multilateral source of population assistance. Since it became operational in 1969, it has provided more than $6 billion in assistance to developing countries.    http://nigeria.unfpa.org/aboutus.htm
properties.address: United Nations House, Plot 617/618, Diplomatic Zone, P.M.B. 2851

properties.name: WellBeing Foundation
properties.information: The WellBeing Foundation is driven by a mission to   encourage the development of all intrinsic qualities in the   people to enable self-development as a means of ensuring   community wellbeing through its participatory model and   multi-sector approach.

properties.name: Women Advocates Research and Documentation Center (WARDC) - Abuja
properties.information: WARDC is a non profit civil rights organisation established   in the year 2000 to promote respect for human rights,   gender equality, equity, rule of law, accountability and   social justice in Nigeria.
properties.address: Main Suite 14, Hilltop Plaza, Plot 2189, IBB Close, Wuze Zone 4

properties.name: Women Advocates Research and Documentation Center (WARDC) - Lagos
properties.information: WARDC is a nonprofit civil rights organisation established in the year 2000 to promote respect for human rights, gender equality, equity, rule of law, accountability and social justice in Nigeria.

properties.name: Women for Empowerment, Development, and Gender Reform
properties.information: The coordinating group is adapting sections on safer sex, HIV/AIDS, birth control, pregnancy, infertility and assisted reproduction into Yoruba and Pidgin English, and developing their health materials in non-book formats.

properties.name: Women in Law and Development in Africa (WiLDAF)
properties.information: WiLDAF undertakes research at both the local and national   levels on topics that influence policy. Its research topics have included maintenance of children, women and   land in the Volta region, and case studies on   implementation of women’s rights in West Africa.

properties.name: Women-in-Detention Rights Initiatve (WIDRI)
properties.information: WIDRI seeks to enhance the unity, development and socio-  economic and political emancipation of the less privileged   in society.
properties.address: 76/87 Ndidem, Usang Iso Road, P.O. Box 1990

properties.name: Womens Aid Collective (WACOL)
properties.information: WACOL is an independent, non-governmental, non-profit   organization dedicated to helping women and young people in   need. WACOL is gender-conscious and works toward gender   equality and human rights for all.
properties.address: P.O. Box 2718, 9 Umuezebi Street, Upper Chime, New Haven

properties.name: Womens Centre for Peace and Development (WOPED)
properties.information: WOPED is an information and advocacy organization  focused on development and ending violence in  Nigeria.
properties.address: 17 Ago Palace Way, Okota, P.O. Box 4410, Oshodi

properties.name: Womens Health and Action Research Center (WHARC)
properties.information: WHARC exists to promote the health and social well-being of   women and adolescents in Africa through systematic   research, documentation and service delivery in sexual and   reproductive health.
properties.address: Km. 11 Lagos-Benin Expressway, Igue-Iheya, P.O. Box 10231

properties.name: Womens Health and Economic Development Association (WHEDA)
properties.information: WHEDA's mission is to sensitize women to the necessity of becoming relevant participants in the developmental processes of their communities. WHEDA does this by promoting social awareness, optimizing economic potentials and nurturing decision-making skills in women through a community-based approach.

properties.name: Womens Health Organization of Nigeria (WHON)
properties.information: WHON works to strengthen the capacity of women’s health groups at the grassroots level in order to enable them to respond to identified health needs of women.

properties.name: Womens Health Research Network in Nigeria (WHERNIN)
properties.information: WHERNIN encourages collaborative research and advocacy  with the Society of Obstetrics and Gynecology of Nigeria.   They organize focus group discussions and awareness   campaigns in rural communities and among marginalized urban   groups.
properties.address: Department of Sociology, Amadou Bello University

properties.name: World Health Organization (WHO) - Nigeria
properties.information: The WHO Department of Making Pregnancy Safer (MPS) helps to   improve maternal health, assists countries to ensure   skilled care before, during and after pregnancy and   childbirth, and strengthen national health systems in order   to achieve Millennium Development Goals 4, 5 and 6.

properties.name: Youth Action Rangers of Nigeria (YARN)
properties.information: YARN is an organization with a mission to empower youth   with information and skills that will help them make   responsible decisions about their reproductive and sexual   health through education, training and advocating for   policy change on all issues affecting them.

properties.name: Youth Empowerment Foundation (YEF)
properties.information: YEF’s mission is the pursuance of overall healthy development of youth through mobilization and empowerment.

properties.name: Youth Resource Development Council
properties.information: The Youth Resource Development Council's activities focus on the economic empowerment of rural women, education regarding the rights of the girl-child, and management of resource centers for youth and rural women.

properties.name: Youth Vision Initiative (YVI)
properties.information: YVI is a non-governmental, non-profit organization that   creates an avenue through which young minds can contribute   to societal and global development.
properties.address: c/o Akinbo A.A. Cornerstone, P.O. Box 17269

properties.name: Youth Vision Plus (YVP)
properties.information: Youth Vision Plus works to empower youth between the ages of 10 and 25 with life-transforming information necessary for growing up in the new millennium.    http://www.kabissa.org/civiorg/783

properties.name: Youth, Adolescent Reflection and Action Centre (YARAC)
properties.information: YARAC's mission is to empower young adults and adolescents   about their reproductive rights and civic responsibilities   through information sharing and transformative education.
properties.address: 23 U Avenue, Federal Lowcost, Miango Road, P.O. Box 6112
